input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: The camper has a direct effect on the forest. The smoker has a direct effect on the forest. The overall probability of the camper lighting a match is 27%. The probability of the camper not lighting a match and the forest on fire is 13%. The probability of the camper lighting a match and the forest on fire is 18%. Is the chance of the forest on fire larger when observing the camper lighting a match?
